page.title: 18DUSTON C.of E.SCHOOL
page.content: The Duston Church of England School was built in 1856.It was only two rooms into which had to fit one hundred children aged from three to fifteen. The building has since been extended and today has one hundred and forty children in it.When the school was first built the children used to sit down in the classrooms from the beginning of school to the end of the day, hardly moving at all. If the children didn't attend school or their work wasn't satisfactory the teacher or headmaster would lose some of his salary. Nowadays there are four and sometimes five classes and the children are aged from four to nine.After they leave they go to either Ryelands or Millway Middle schools.
